content:
![img-0.jpeg](images/image_1_0.jpeg)
FIGURE 5.1 The arrangement of iron filings surrounding a bar magnet. The pattern mimics magnetic field lines. The pattern suggests that the bar magnet is a magnetic dipole.

![img-1.jpeg](images/image_2_1.jpeg)
(a)

![img-2.jpeg](images/image_2_2.jpeg)
(b)

![img-3.jpeg](images/image_2_3.jpeg)
(c)
summary: The imagery in this section helps to visualize the concept of magnetic field lines, and explains how they form a pattern akin to that of iron filings around a bar magnet.
hypothetical_questions: What is the pattern formed by magnetic field lines around a magnet?
Can you predict the shape and orientation of magnetic field lines around a circular magnet?
